---
title: "data_exploration"
format: html
---

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
cites <- read.csv("cites_felidae_1975_2024.csv")
cites_recent <- read.csv("cites_felidae_2000_2024.csv")
```

```{r}
summary(cites)

cites %>%
  count(Taxon) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Taxon, y = n)) +
  geom_col() +
  coord_flip()

common_names <- data.frame(
  Taxon = c(
    "Panthera leo", 
    "Panthera tigris", 
    "Acinonyx jubatus", 
    "Panthera pardus", 
    "Lynx rufus", 
    "Puma concolor", 
    "Lynx lynx", 
    "Leptailurus serval", 
    "Caracal caracal", 
    "Lynx canadensis"
  ),
  CommonName = c(
    "Lion", 
    "Tiger", 
    "Cheetah", 
    "Leopard", 
    "Bobcat", 
    "Mountain Lion", 
    "Eurasian Lynx", 
    "Serval", 
    "Caracal", 
    "Canada Lynx"
  )
)

# Step 1: Count instances per Taxon
species_count <- cites %>%
  count(Taxon)  

# Step 2: Merge counts and common names
top_species <- species_count %>%
  left_join(common_names, by = "Taxon")  

# Step 3: Arrange and select top 10 species
top_species <- top_species %>%
  arrange(n) %>%                          
  slice_max(n, n = 10)                   

# Step 4: Plotting top 10 species
ggplot(top_species, aes(x = reorder(paste(CommonName, Taxon, sep = " ("), n), y = n)) +
  geom_col() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal()
```
